subject: Photography
title: Backlighting and Silhouettes
description: A micro-lesson that makes Backlighting and Silhouettes usable.

hook.text: Point your camera toward the sun and your subject becomes a dark outline. A silhouette is pure shape.

buildup.text: Backlighting places the light source behind the subject, throwing the front into shadow.

discovery.text: Silhouettes strip away detail and reduce subjects to shape. Identity becomes posture and outline.

twist.text: Hair and fur glow when backlit â€” a rim of gold called rim light. It separates subjects from backgrounds beautifully.

climax.text: Backlighting is risky. Expose for the sky and silhouettes form. Expose for the subject and the sky blows out.

punchline.text: Sometimes the most powerful portrait shows no face at all.

quiz.question: What is 'rim light' in backlighting?
options: A glowing edge around the subject created by light from behind
